intro: Ajania semnanensis, commonly known as the Persian ajania, is a flowering plant native to Iran. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers. The plant is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in rocky and arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
